org.transitime.config

Class ConfigValue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.config.ConfigValue<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanConfigValue, DoubleConfigValue, FloatConfigValue, IntegerConfigValue, LongConfigValue, StringConfigValue, StringListConfigValue

    public abstract class ConfigValue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for storing a single param. These params are read from an XML file at both startup and when data needs to be reread. Goal is to make the accessing of the data fast, since it might be accessed in loops. Yet also want to be able to reread the data when needed. Also works when need a list of data.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

      An exception for when a parameter is being read in

        public ConfigValue(java.lang.String id,
           T defaultValue,
           java.lang.String description,

        Stores info associated with ConfigValue. Outputs error message if id param null or already used.
        Parameters:
        id -
        defaultValue -
        description -
        okToLogValue - If false then won't log value in log file. This is useful for passwords and such.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Gets the value. Intended to be fast because might be used in loops. Therefore there is no locking.
        Returns:
        the current value of the param.

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        Returns the ID of the parameter. This can be useful for outputting as part of error messages so that user can see what parameter needs to be modified when there is a problem.
        Returns:

      • readValue

        public void readValue(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> configData)
               throws ConfigValue.ConfigParamException
        Reads value from the config file data and stores it
        Parameters:
        configData - HashMap of data read in from config file. The key is the name of the param. The value is a List so that can better handle params that have multiple elements. If null then default values will be used.
        Throws:
        ConfigValue.ConfigParamException

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the parameter.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        So that the value is returned instead of the default toString() which returns the object ID. This makes debugging easier.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
